invite.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc
invite.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Who should we invite to the party?
Gail invited me to stay with her while her husband was out of town.
Why don’t you invite her for a drink at the club one evening?
invite.translation[0].definitions[0].not: You invite someone to an event or a place
Did they invite you to the wedding?
She invited me to her house
You invite someone for a meal or a period of time
I’ll invite them for the weekend
invite.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to politely ask someone to do something
invite.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Anyone interested in contributing articles is invited to contact the editor.
invite.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to encourage something bad to happen, especially without intending to
invite.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Any government that sells arms to dictators is inviting trouble.
invite.translation[1].definitions[0].def: an invitation to a party, meal etc
invite.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to offer someone the opportunity to do something
invite.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Contractors will then be invited to tender for the work.
Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates.
The country has invited bids from foreign firms to explore for oil and natural gas.
invite.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to ask someone to come to an event
invite.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: I was not invited to the meeting.
